top.title: Most consumers interacted with AI customer service during holiday shopping
top.snippet: Consumers’ response to AI and automation is largely positive, but a majority still say humans provide better support, a Liveops survey found.
top.rerankWhy: Highlights consumer interaction with AI in retail
top.aiSummary:
AI-generated summary:
A Liveops survey revealed that while most consumers had positive interactions with AI customer service during holiday shopping, the majority still believe human support is superior.

top.title: 2026 will prove whether AI checkout is here to stay
top.snippet: 2025 showed that more shoppers were eager and willing to start their shopping journeys on AI engines like ChatGPT and Perplexity. Now, 2026 will be the year that proves whether shoppers have gotten comfortable enough with the technology to click "buy" within these AI platforms.
top.rerankWhy: Explores the future of AI in shopping
top.aiSummary: AI checkout's future will be determined in 2026 as shoppers increasingly use AI engines like ChatGPT and Perplexity to start their shopping journeys, with the question being whether they will be comfortable enough to complete purchases within these platforms.

top.title: AI and the Human Condition
top.snippet: AI might replace all of the jobs; that's only a problem if you think that humans will care, but if they care, they will create new jobs.
top.rerankWhy: Discusses AI's impact on jobs and society
top.aiSummary: AI may potentially replace all jobs, but whether this is a concern depends on human perspectives; if humans are worried, they can generate new job opportunities.

top.title: Why 2025 was Shopify’s best year yet
top.snippet: Shopify just wrapped up its strongest year since 2021, with record sales growth, major enterprise brand wins and an OpenAI partnership positioning the company as core infrastructure for AI-driven shopping.
top.rerankWhy: Highlights Shopify's record growth and AI partnership
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
In 2025, Shopify experienced its best year yet, marked by record sales growth, significant enterprise brand victories, and a partnership with OpenAI, solidifying its role as essential infrastructure for AI-powered shopping.

top.title: Retail’s data moment: Why trusted customer data is the new competitive edge
top.snippet: Shopper expectations are rising, channels are multiplying and AI is redefining how, where and why people buy.
top.rerankWhy: Discusses the importance of trusted customer data
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Retail Dive's article discusses how trusted customer data is becoming crucial in the competitive landscape of retail, as shopper expectations rise, channels multiply, and AI reshapes the buying experience.

top.title: Bed Bath & Beyond operating chief out as Marcus Lemonis takes on CEO role
top.snippet: Lemonis outlined a plan that moves the company beyond retail and into insurance, financial tools and “mortgage related solutions.”
top.rerankWhy: Covers leadership changes impacting retail strategy
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Bed Bath & Beyond's operating chief is leaving as Marcus Lemonis becomes CEO, with plans to expand the company into insurance, financial tools, and mortgage-related solutions.

top.title: Lovesac reshores key manufacturing process
top.snippet: The direct-to-consumer furniture retailer plans to start domestic production of core inserts for its primary product line.
top.rerankWhy: Focuses on reshoring manufacturing in retail
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Lovesac, a direct-to-consumer furniture retailer, will reshore the manufacturing of core inserts for its main product line, moving production domestically.

top.title: Lululemon founder Chip Wilson scuffles with board amid CEO search
top.snippet: The brand says it wants to avoid a proxy fight but that Wilson “declined to engage further” after nominating three people to its board.
top.rerankWhy: Details board dynamics affecting Lululemon's future
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Lululemon founder Chip Wilson has clashed with the board during the CEO search, with the brand aiming to prevent a proxy fight as Wilson nominated three individuals to the board but declined further engagement.

top.title: Expect skinification to hit mass retail aisles in 2026
top.snippet: Once limited to prestige brands, skinification is becoming table stakes across personal care aisles as people look for ingredient-specific solutions.
top.rerankWhy: Explores emerging trends in personal care retail
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Skinification, previously exclusive to high-end brands, is now a common trend in personal care aisles as consumers seek ingredient-specific solutions.

top.title: New Car Sales Are Rising Thanks to Purchases by the Well-Off
top.snippet: A larger proportion of new cars are being bought by affluent Americans as prices and interest rates for auto loans climb, analysts said.
top.rerankWhy: Highlights luxury consumer trends in auto sales
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
New car sales are increasing among wealthy Americans due to rising prices and interest rates for auto loans, according to analysts.

top.title: Pat McGrath Labs seeks a buyer
top.snippet: Bids are due to Hilco Global by Jan. 26, with a public auction for the beauty brand’s assets to be held on Jan. 27.
top.rerankWhy: Relevant to luxury beauty market dynamics
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Pat McGrath Labs is up for sale, with bids due by Jan. 26 and a public auction for the beauty brand's assets scheduled for Jan. 27, as reported by Retail Dive on January 5, 2026.

top.title: Jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge receives MBE
top.snippet:
British jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge has been awarded a Mem­ber of the Order of the Brit­ish Empire (MBE) for her ser­vices to design. As always, these awards are handed out dur­ing the year by King Charles III and mem­bers of the royal fam­ily. Based in London, Azagury-Partridge runs her own jewellery brand Solange, with a […]
The post Jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge receives MBE appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Recognition of a prominent jewellery designer's achievements
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge has been awarded an MBE for her services to design, presented by King Charles III. She runs her own brand, Solange, based in London.

top.title: Tiffany rides into 2026 Chinese New Year with campaign
top.snippet:
Tiffany & Co has unveiled its 2026 Chinese New Year campaign, uniting a Pegasus motif with the House’s most celebrated designs to mark the arrival of a new year. The campaign features a Pegasus motif inspired by a brooch created under the artistic direction of Nathalie Verdeille, chief artistic officer, and rooted in the imaginative world of Jean Schlumberger. The campaign […]
The post Tiffany rides into 2026 Chinese New Year with campaign appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Tiffany's campaign highlights cultural significance in jewellery
top.aiSummary: Tiffany & Co's 2026 Chinese New Year campaign features a Pegasus motif inspired by Jean Schlumberger's imaginative world, marking the arrival of the new year. The campaign showcases the House's celebrated designs under the artistic direction of Nathalie Verdeille.

top.title: Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026
top.snippet:
As we enter into 2026, inflation rates are increasing as prices continued to edge up at the end of last year. According to the British Retail Consortium, shop price inflation picked up to 0.7% year on year in December, against growth of 0.6% in November. This is in line with the 3-month average of 0.7%. […]
The post Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026 appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Inflation impacts on jewellery pricing and retail
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Inflation rates are on the rise in 2026, with shop price inflation increasing to 0.7% year on year in December according to the British Retail Consortium. This trend is expected to persist in the jewellery industry.

top.title: How indie retailers will shape the high street in 2026
top.snippet:
One of the things I love most about working with independent retailers is their resilience and adaptability. They have weathered everything the world has thrown at them over the past few years, including shifting consumer behaviours, economic pressures, rising costs, and the arrival of new technologies. Yet they have kept innovating, kept experimenting, and kept […]
